required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Partner Involvement During Pregnancy and Its Association With Maternal Health Behaviors
clinical_study.official_title: Partner Involvement During Pregnancy and Its Association With Maternal Health Behaviors

brief_summary.textblock: This study assessed the relationship between pregnant women, partner support, and cigarette and alcohol use in pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock: Paternal support is related to positive pregnancy outcomes. We explored the relationship between paternal involvement and maternal smoking and alcohol consumption during pregnancy. This was an IRB-approved cross sectional study. Pregnant women between the ages of 18 - 44 years old and their partners were surveyed in the outpatient OB/GYN offices of Thomas Jefferson University. Women who identified their partner as their main support were included. Demographic and health information was collected. A composite support score for each woman was generated from a modified version of the Norbeck Social Support Questionnaire (NSSQ) on a scale from 5 - 35. Support scores were evaluated with women's current smoking and drinking status using ANOVA and Student's t-test.

primary_outcome.measure: A composite support score for each woman from a modified version of the Norbeck Social Support Questionnaire (NSSQ) on a scale from 5 - 35.
primary_outcome.description: Cigarette and Alcohol use in pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: Paternal support is related to positive pregnancy outcomes. We explored the relationship between paternal involvement and maternal smoking and alcohol consumption during pregnancy. This was an IRB-approved cross sectional study. Pregnant women between the ages of 18 - 44 years old and their partners were surveyed in the outpatient OB/GYN offices of Thomas Jefferson University. Women who identified their partner as their main support were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women between the ages of 18 - 44 years old and their partners were surveyed in the outpatient OB/GYN offices of Thomas Jefferson University. Women who identified their partner as their main support were included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-English speaking.

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
